intro: Carmichaelia williamsii, commonly known as the Williams' kowhai, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt-laden winds. It is an important species for both ecological and cultural reasons in New Zealand. Its flowers attract native birds, contributing to the local pollination process.
